description: Borrowed from Zulu índaba (“affair, issue, matter; piece of news; story”), from ín- (class 9 noun prefix) + -daɓa (stem meaning ‘affair, matter’).

entries.meaning: A tribal conference held by Nguni leaders.
(by extension) Any conference, discussion, or meeting.
Chiefly in one's own or someone's indaba: a concern, matter, or problem.
(by extension, Scouting) An international conference of Scout leaders.
